titleStmt.title: H. Rodman to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7005

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The undersigned residents of the City of Frankfort represent to your Excellency that Richard Parker was fined $500 and costs in the Police Court of the City of Frankfort on the 1st Sept 1865 for a breach of the peace.

That the said Parker committed the offense under cirtcumstances which should in our Opinion greatly excuse him, as he was threatened and menaced by Kremens (whom Parker assaulted) and Your Petioners Knowing well the good character of Parker pray that the fine against him may be remitted.

H Rodman
M B. Chinn
D. Kirkpatrick
Wm Shindelhower
W H,, Gray
Wm A Gaines
Geo W Miller
J. W. Russell
J. L Waggener
Chas G Russell
W, T, Bacon
W T, Reading
Tho. A. Theobald
John J. Roberts
J J Craddok
S. G. Suddarth
D. W. Lindsey
Thos C. Kyle.

Frankfort P. Ct
vs
R. Parker
$5 --
Breach Peace
Remitted 1st Sept /65
